Dear Mr. Derscheid:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
During a restraint, staff pinched youth, leaving marks. Staff members have been
aggressive with youth, twisting youth's arm. Multiple staff are involved.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 16, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described staff as being “ok” but
reported staff “leave bruises and stuff when doing restraints.” Youth A denied any
particular staff member leaving bruises. Youth A denied staff doing restraints when
2

not warranted. Youth A stated he was restrained recently but did not have any
bruises, scratches or concerns with the restraint. Youth A stated he could not
remember the last time he got a bruise or scratch from a restraint. Youth A denied
staff being rough or twisting his arm during any restraints. Youth A denied having
any concerns with any staff member, including Administrator.
Medical was interviewed via telephone on June 16, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Medical stated she has examined Youth A a couple of times, most
recently the morning of June 14, 2022. Medical stated Youth A had one linear
yellowish bruise area, approximately 2cm long on left side near axilla of his chest.
Medical reported Youth A stated he did not know what the bruise was from and did
not seem to know it was even there. Medical reported Youth A did not have any
complaints of pain. Medical reported this was the first time seeing a bruise when
examining Youth A.
Administrator was interviewed face to face on June 16, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Administrator reported being involved in one physical
management with Youth A where he held Youth A’s wrist to get money from his
hand that Youth A had taken from a piggy bank. Administrator stated he held Youth
A’s hand with one hand, got the money and released his hand. Administrator denied
ever twisting Youth A’s arm or pinching him. Administrator stated he could not recall
the last time he did a restraint on Youth A. Administrator stated he has witnessed
staff restrain Youth A and has not had any concerns. Administrator denied seeing
any bruises on Youth A or other youth after being restrained. Administrator denied
Youth A voicing any concerns about restraints or how staff are performing restraints.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face on June 16, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he has restrained Youth A and has watched other
staff restrain Youth A. Staff 1 denied having any concerns with how staff complete
restraints or seeing staff pinch Youth A. Staff 1 reported the restraints with Youth A
do not last very long and Youth A does not really fight against the restraint. Staff 1
stated Youth A picks at scabs and mosquito bites but denied ever seeing any
bruises. Staff 1 denied Youth A ever coming to him with concerns.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face on June 16, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he has restrained Youth A and has watched other
staff restrain Youth A. Staff 2 denied having any concerns with how staff complete
restraints or seeing staff pinch Youth A. Staff 2 denied Youth A ever coming to him
with concerns.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face on June 24, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Supervisor denied seeing any bruises on Youth A. Supervisor
denied seeing staff pinch Youth A or Youth A ever express concerns of being
pinched. Supervisor stated he did not have any concerns with staff performing
restraints. Supervisor reported Youth A does not fight the restraints too much and
does not recall ever seeing any bruising on Youth A after any restraint.
3

Staff 3 was interviewed face to face on June 24, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 3 denied seeing any bruising on Youth A or seeing staff pinch
Youth A. Staff 3 stated he is usually the one to debrief with Youth A after a restraint
and Youth A has never expressed any concerns.
Youth B was interviewed face to face on June 24, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Youth B reported some youth say there are “dirty restraints” but he
does not know why. Youth B stated he saw a restraint where a staff member
slammed a youth’s head on the gym floor and the youth got a bloody nose (This was
investigated in SIR2022C0128011). Youth B reported feeling safe at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face on June 24, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Youth C stated the restraints are “alright” and he does not have any
concerns. Youth C denied seeing staff hurt, pinch or twist the arm of any youth
during restraints. Youth C stated he did not have any concern with any of his
restraints. Youth C reported feeling safe at the facility.
DHHS Worker has no findings in his investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
 Michigan Department of Health and Human Services Incident Reports
137120197, 137500196, 137540194,137550197, 137580205, 137610194 for
Youth A. Reports are consistent with staff and youth interviews and do not
list any injuries for Youth A.
 Pineview Homes Post restraint checks for Youth A completed by Medical,
consistent with Medical and staff interviews.
 Administrator, Staff 1 and Staff 3’s personnel files: There were no disciplinary
records. Administrator completed the required Safe Crisis Management
training in February 2022, Staff 1 completed the training on June 9, 2022 and
Staff 3 completed the training on August 16 – 20, 2021.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition,
medical condition, psychiatric condition, and personal
history, including any history of trauma, and must be done
in a manner consistent with the youth’s treatment plan
4

ANALYSIS: The facility is found in compliance as interviews with youth and
staff do not support the allegations of staff pinching, leaving
bruises or twisting Youth A’s arm during restraints.
Technical Assistance:
The facility was reminded to describe the actions of the youth in
incident reports that warranted the restraint. The final rule
restraint and seclusion rules that took effect May 31, 2022 was
discussed and reviewed with Chief Administrator and
Administrator.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Youth was placed in a restraint for spitting at staff.
INVESTIGATION:
I reviewed incident reports that involved Youth A from June 1 – June 15, 2022, when
the special investigation was assigned due to the broad allegations and not having a
specific day or restraint identified. In reviewing those restraints, I read incident
report 137590194 that indicated Youth A was restrained for spitting on Staff 3.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face on June 24, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he restrained Youth A because Youth A was trying
to spit on staff. Staff 3 stated when a youth spits that it is “grounds for a restraint,
due to it being an assault.” Staff 3 stated, “you don’t have to restrain but you can.”
Staff 3 is a trainer in Safe Crisis Management.
Documents Reviewed:
 Michigan Department of Health and Human Services Incident Report
137590194 described Youth A being restrained for trying to spit on Staff 3.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Rule 160. The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving
response for a youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others
from an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that
places the youth or others at serious threat of violence or
injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as Youth A was
restrained for spitting at Staff 3.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR2022C0116037 dated 7/5/22; CAP not due until 7/20/22
